revised_title: Cracking of Cyclopentane and n-Pentane on a Silica-Alumina Catalyst: A Comparative Study
tldr: The authors studied the cracking of cyclopentane and n-pentane on a silica-alumina catalyst to understand the differences in their cracking behavior. They found that the formation of carbonium ions and polymerization processes were different for the two reactants. The study provides insights into the mechanisms of the reactions and the role of Lewis acid sites in the formation of olefins and carbonium ions from saturated compounds.
